item.title: Rural Villa in Dietikon
item.description: Province Germania Superior Province Description Location Dietikon Dietikon (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Dietikon Keywords archaeological garden axial plan corridors pergolas piscinae porticoes rural villas villae rusticae Garden Description This villa rustica complex was built on a site at the bottom of a valley near and parallel to the river Limmat. Dietikon was situated on an important land and water traffic route from the BÃ¼ndner Alps to Vindonissa and further north to the Rhine. Recent excavations supply valuable evidence for a garden in front of the entrance to a rural residence, giving insight into the appearance of other similar villas at which, for one reason or another, no physical remains of gardens have been retrieved. The excavations revealed a first villa with timber buildings dating to the Tiberian period, or early 1st century AD.
